business.headline: Filing ITR? Here's how to choose the right tax regimeWhile the new regime offers reduced tax slabs, it doesn't let you claim the usual deductions available under the old regime. It's lower rates, but with fewer tax-saving options.

Whisky, cars, and jobs: Inside India's game-changing UK free trade pactThe India-UK trade deal holds significance in a world drifting back toward trade barriers and tariff wars. With Trump-era protectionism rearing its head again, the timing of this pact couldn't be better.
PwC to cut 1,500 jobs in the US: ReportLast year, PwC was in the news for possibly cutting half of its auditing staff in China's financial services sector.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes nearly 6% after 'Operation Sindoor'The Karachi Stock Exchange 100 index (KSE-100) plunged 6,272 points in early trade, sliding to 107,296.64 — a sharp drop from Tuesday's close of 113,568.51.

Explained: Why Info Edge shares look like they've crashed 80% todayInfo Edge shares traded ex-split today after the company carried out a 1:5 stock split, its first since its 2006 listing. As a result, each share with a face value of Rs 10 has been subdivided into five shares of Rs 2 each.

Explained: Why foreign portfolio investors are buying Indian financial stocksData from the National Securities Depository shows FPIs bought Rs 18,409 crore ($2.18 billion) worth of shares in the sector last month, propelling the Nifty Financial Services index to a 4.1% gain.

Scotch whisky prices set to drop after India-UK trade deal. Details hereThe reduction is expected to bring premium and mid-range Scotch whiskies within reach of a larger section of Indian consumers. A bottle that typically costs Rs 5,000 could soon be priced between Rs 3,500 and Rs 4,000 following the initial tariff cut.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as markets stay calm after 'Operation Sindoor'The Sensex fell sharply in pre-opening, but recovered as soon as the markets opened at 9:15 am. At around 9:30 am, Sensex was trading 143.08 points higher at 80,784.15, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 56.60 points to trade at 24,432.

Paytm nears full profitability; revenue grows to Rs 1,911 crorePaytm's revenue increased by 5% quarter-on-quarter, reaching Rs 1,911 crore, reflecting the company's steady performance and continued momentum in its core businesses.

Need a personal loan? Unlock Rs 5 lakh instantly using just your PAN cardTo apply online, you simply visit the bank or lender's website and fill out the application form. You'll need to provide your name, date of birth, mobile number, and PAN number.

Sensex ends 156 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Adani Enterprises falls 4%The BSE Sensex ended 155.77 points lower at 80,641.07, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to settle at 24,379.60. Most of the broader market indices also declined during the trading session due to high selling pressure.

entertainment.headline: Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock to reunite after Speed for a romantic thrillerKeanu Reeves and Sandra Bullock are reuniting for a new romantic thriller, marking their first collaboration in nearly 30 years. The film, produced by Mark Gordon, promises a fast-paced and emotionally charged narrative.

Janhvi Kapoor reacts to trolls saying Indians are 'Chandivalification of Met'Actor Janhvi Kapoor hit back at trolls mocking Indian celebrities at the Met Gala 2025, calling out classist and colonial mindsets. She praised Indian designers and celebrities for finally getting the global recognition they long deserved.

Allu Arjun meets Aamir Khan at his residence, viral photo sparks collab rumours'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun recently visited Bollywood actor Aamir Khan at his residence. After a photo from the meeting went viral, fans began speculating that the superstars might be collaborating on a pan-India project soon.

Sidharth-Janhvi's Param Sundari teaser to be attached with Bhool Chuk MaafThe highly-awaited teaser of 'Param Sundar' will release on May 9, but there is a catch. The promo will not be available for immediate viewing anywhere on the internet.

Shah Rukh Khan says Met Gala is not his 'space' in 1st post after his grand debutShah Rukh Khan shared a few more photos of his Met Gala look on social media, and called the event not his 'space' in the caption. He thanked his team for making him feel 'comfortable' about the entire experience.

Jackson Wang, Diljit Dosanjh ask 'do you wanna dance' in 1st collaboration. WatchGlobal icons Jackson Wang and Diljit Dosanjh have teamed up for a new single, Buck. The teaser is out now, promising a genre-defying collaboration that blends their unique styles.

Hina Khan reacts to Nishat sexual assault case, says rape can never be justifiedHina Khan took to Instagram to share her thoughts on the recent sexual assault and murder in Nishat, Srinagar. She emphasised the importance of distinguishing between rape and sexual assault and urged coexistence among communities.

Karan Johar says he's battling body dysmorphia: Can't even look myself in mirrorKaran Johar spoke about having insecurities with his body. He said he has a condition which makes him dislike his own body, but he's aware of the issues and working on them.

Jailer 2 director's meeting with Mohanlal sparks cameo rumoursDirector Nelson Dilipkumar recently met Malayalam superstar Mohanlal on the sets of 'Hridayapoorvam'. This sparked the actor's cameo in 'Jailer 2'.

Fighter's fight begins: Rajinikanth supports India's Operation SindoorSuperstar Rajinikanth reacted to India's mission against Pakistan-backed terrorism, code-named Operation Sindoor. He wrote that the entire nation is with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Total justice: Akshay Kumar to Kangana Ranaut, celebs on Operation SindoorOn May 7, India launched Operation Sindoor, attacking nine terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood celebrities, including Akshay Kumar, Kangana Ranaut and Suniel Shetty, among others, have reacted to the mission.

Kabir Khan opens up about creative differences with Salman Khan during Ek Tha Tiger shootDirector Kabir Khan shared insights into the challenges faced while working with Salman Khan on the set of 'Ek Tha Tiger'. He revealed that the film wasn't entirely under his control due to creative differences.

Raid 2 box office Day 6: Ajay's film sees good run on weekdays, nears Rs 90 crore'Raid 2', starring Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh, is slowly moving closer to the benchmark of Rs 100 crore at the box office. The film has got two more days to work well until a new film releases on Friday.

Diljit Dosanjh takes ChatGPT's help in BTS video with Shakira: I'm learning EnglishDijit Dosanjh used ChatGPT's help to learn English in BTS video with Shakira and Nicole Scherzinger and others. The actor-singer made his debut at Met Gala 2025.

Malti cutely joins Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas's Met Gala photoshoot. See picsMany wondered what Priyanka and Nick's daughter Malti did while the couple attended the MET Gala. Well, Nick's latest pictures documented everything.

Chiranjeevi, Riteish Deshmukh, celebs react to Operation SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor and attacked nine terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Chiranjeevi, Kajal Aggarwal, Riteish Deshmukh and several celebrities have reacted to the mission.

Why Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Skipped the 2025 Met GalaTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce skipped the 2025 Met Gala due to vacation plans. The couple prioritized downtime post-tour and NFL season over fashion's biggest night, despite growing anticipation.

Rihanna and Ciara end 14-year feud at 2025 Met Gala with heartfelt reunion Rihanna and Ciara ended their 14-year feud with a warm reunion at the 2025 Met Gala. The pop stars bonded over motherhood and fashion, celebrating Rihanna's third pregnancy.

A24 taps Alex Garland for dark fantasy Elden Ring film adaptationAlex Garland will direct a live-action Elden Ring film for A24, adapting the acclaimed fantasy RPG. Production is slated for 2026, marking Garland's next major cinematic project.

general news.headline: Scalp, Hammer: Why these were India's weapons of choice to hit Pak terror campsOperation Sindoor: Rafale jets armed with SCALP cruise missiles and HAMMER precision-guided munitions were used for the strikes on terror camps in Pakistan.

LoC hots up after Op Sindoor strikes, 10 Indians killed; evacuations orderedUnion Home Minister Amit Shah has ordered evacuations of civilians near the Line of Control, after indiscriminate firing by the Pakistan Army led to the killing of 10 people. The Army responded swiftly with reports of heavy military casualties.

India's Rafale vs Pak's F-16: Air power in focus after Operation SindoorThe success of Operation Sindoor reveals a clear technological and operational edge for India when India's Rafale and Pakistan's F-16 series jets are put head to head.

No terror camps in Pak? Journalist fact-checks minister on air after India strikesPakistani I&B Minister Attaullah Tarar was challenged by journalist Yalda Hakim on live television after claiming there are no terror camps in Pakistan.

Operation Sindoor is unique, it hit at the heart of PakistanOperation Sindoor is unique because it hit terror camps, including those in the heart of Pakistan, in its Punjab province. This is the first time since the 1971 War that India has hit targets in Pakistan's Punjab, and destroyed four terror camps in a 25-minute operation.

Here's proof. Video shows Jaish headquarters turned to rubble in Indian strikesIndian Today TV exclusively accessed visuals of the damaged Subhan Allah camp in Pakistan's Bahawalpur, which served as the den of terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed, behind deadly attacks such as the 2001 Parliament and 2019 Pulwama attacks.

PM Modi named it Operation Sindoor. Here's whyIn a coordinated tri-service strike, India hit nine terror targets in Pakistan and POK under 'Operation Sindoor', personally named by PM Modi to honour widows of the April 22 Pahalgam attack.

4 drones came...everything destroyed: Pak eyewitness recounts India's strikesA local from Pakistan, speaking about India's strikes, said four drones came and attacked a mosque. 'Everything got destroyed,' he said.

Funded by bin Laden, trained Ajmal Kasab: Why India hit LeT's Muridke MarkazEstablished in 2000 and allegedly funded in part by Osama bin Laden with a contribution of Rs 10 million, the Masjid wa Markaz Taiba in Pakistan's Muridke is central to the Hafiz Saeed-led terror outfit's operations.

Operation Sindoor: In the name is India's message, both humane and heroicIndia hit terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) in pre-dawn strikes on Wednesday. It named it Operation Sindoor. Not just the strikes, even the name of the mission is supposed to convey a message to the world.

Military strikes in Pak regrettable: China urges both sides to remain calmChina has termed India's airstrikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir 'regrettable' and urged both sides to exercise restraint and avoid further escalation.

Indian airspace being monitored, it's a national emergency: Government sourcesFollowing India's retaliatory strikes on terror targets in Pakistan and POK, flight operations at five northern airports have been suspended, triggering widespread travel disruptions.

Uri, Pulwama, and now Pahalgam: India's message to Pak is loud and clearJust 15 days after the Pahalgam terror attack, India carried out strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and POK. Previously, India had launched similar operations in 2016 following the Uri attack, and in 2019 in response to the Pulwama attack.

Response to brutal killing of our innocent brothers: Amit Shah on Op SindoorHome Minister Amit Shah was hard-hitting in his first reaction to 'Operation Sindoor', in which India struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation to the Pahalgam carnage. Taking to X, he tweeted that the operation was in response to the brutal killing of "innocent brothers".

Op Sindoor: S Jaishankar is blunt, says world must show zero tolerance for terrorIn a blunt, first reaction to 'Operation Sindoor', External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the "world must show zero tolerance for terrorism" as India struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation to the Pahalgam massacre in which terrorists killed 26 people.

Donald Trump says he knew India would retaliate, hopes it ends quicklyReacting to India's airstrikes under Operation Sindoor, US President Donald Trump called the situation "a shame" and urged India and Pakistan to de-escalate tensions, saying, "Nobody wants to see two powerful nations going down that road."

Damaged buildings, mosques and blackout in terror camps: Operation Sindoor in picsIn retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack, India on Wednesday conducted precision strikes on nine terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK).

This is bare minimum: Congress leader questions impact of Operation SindoorWhile the Congress leadership was unanimous in praising the armed forces for Operation Sindoor, Congress leader Rashid Alvi struck a discordant note.

Calculated, measured show of force: How foreign media reported Operation SindoorWhile Operation Sindoor was a significant military operation, it was equally a strategic exercise in shaping global perception. Most international media echoed the Indian stance that this was a calibrated counter-terror strike rather than an act of aggression.

Jaish headquarters, Lashkar camp: Why India chose these 9 terror targetsIn India's deepest cross-border strikes since Balakot, nine terror camps in Pakistan and POK were hit under "Operation Sindoor", including Jaish-e-Mohammad's Bahawalpur base and Lashkar's Muridke facility.

Karan Johar says he's battling body dysmorphia: Can't even look myself in mirrorKaran Johar spoke about having insecurities with his body. He said he has a condition which makes him dislike his own body, but he's aware of the issues and working on them.

Hint before the storm: Army's video minutes before Op Sindoor announcementThe precision missile attacks, named Operation Sindoor, were carried out on nine terror targets, including in Punjab's Bhawalpur, the stronghold of Jaish-e-Mohammad.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

sports.headline: IPL 2025 to continue as scheduled amid India-Pakistan tensions: SourcesThe Indian Premier League will continue as scheduled amid the escalating tension between India and Pakistan, an indian cricket board source said. 14 more matches, including the final, is set to be played in the next three weeks.

Sachin Tendulkar, Shikhar Dhawan praise India's Operation SindoorSachin Tendulkar and Shikhar Dhawan showed strong support after Indian forces launched a coordinated attack on terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Inconsistent KKR eye late playoffs charge vs woeful ChennaiIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders need to win all their games to make it to the playoffs this season. They face Chennai Super Kings at home, a team that has already been knocked out this season.

IPL playoffs qualification scenarios: Can Mi top table despite losing to GT?IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians can qualify for the playoffs despite losing their 12th match to Gujarat Titans on Tuesday. The five-time champions can even finish in the top two.

Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra fined for breaching IPL Code of Conduct in thrillerMumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya was fined Rs. 24 lakh for his team's second slow over-rate offense of the season, while Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra was fined 25% of his match fees and handed a demerit point for conduct deemed "contrary to the spirit of the game."

MI will treat every game as playoffs now: Mahela JayawardeneMumbai Indians lost to Gujarat Titans in a rain-affected game on Tuesday. The loss complicated Mumbai's  chances of qualifying for the IPL playoffs.

Mumbai Indians must win both games to control their destiny in IPL 2025: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble has explained the qualification scenarios for both Mumbai Indians (MI) and Gujarat Titans (GT) after the rain-marred IPL 2025 thriller at the Wankhede.

Hardik Pandya not bowling final over can cost MI place in playoff: Sunil GavaskarIndia great Sunil Gavaskar has slammed Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya for giving the final over to Deepak Chahar after GT secured a three-wicket win under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method to go on top of the IPL points table.

Operation Sindoor: Gambhir welcomes India's strikes on Pakistan terror campsThe cricketing fraternity of India showed strong support after India conducted precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir at midnight on May 7. Operation Sindoor is estimated to have eliminated 80 terrorists through coordinated attacks.

Hansi Flick fumes over refereeing decisions after Champions League exitBarcelona's Champions League journey ended after a dramatic semi-final defeat against Inter Milan. Controversial referee decisions sparked outrage amongst Barcelona fans including coach Hansi Flick.

Mumbai Indians must win both games to control their destiny in IPL 2025: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble has explained the qualification scenarios for both Mumbai Indians (MI) and Gujarat Titans (GT) after the rain-marred IPL 2025 thriller at the Wankhede.

Hardik Pandya not bowling final over can cost MI place in playoff: Sunil GavaskarIndia great Sunil Gavaskar has slammed Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya for giving the final over to Deepak Chahar after GT secured a three-wicket win under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method to go on top of the IPL points table.

Operation Sindoor: Gambhir welcomes India's strikes on Pakistan terror campsThe cricketing fraternity of India showed strong support after India conducted precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir at midnight on May 7. Operation Sindoor is estimated to have eliminated 80 terrorists through coordinated attacks.

Hansi Flick fumes over refereeing decisions after Champions League exitBarcelona's Champions League journey ended after a dramatic semi-final defeat against Inter Milan. Controversial referee decisions sparked outrage amongst Barcelona fans including coach Hansi Flick.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
